user.biography: Greenpeace exists because this fragile earth deserves a voice. It needs solutions. It needs change. It needs action.

node.text:
Aurelie, a scientist from Mauritius and daughter of a fisherman, always felt a strong connection with the ocean.
.
Growing up by a beach she witnessed the unsustainable development affecting the ocean. Her life mission is to inspire future generations to protect the ocean, starting where land meets the sea.
.
@aurelie_hector @jake_letori
.
.
.
#VitalOceanVoices #ProtectTheOceans #IndianOcean #Mauritius #Madagascar #Seychelles #Oceans #Seas #Greenpeace

node.text:
The sea is rising higher and faster — floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.

But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.

How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming.

Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.

#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #Greenpeace #jakarta #taiwan #taipei #asia #globalwarming

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

node.text:
In May, @greenpeacekorea and sand drawing team A Plan created 5 sand paintings of climate-crisis species and people on Taean Beach, South Korea to warn that the current climate crisis, accompanied by rising temperatures, would destroy our ecosystem as easily as the waves destroyed the sand drawings.

Greenpeace is urging governments to implement the Paris Agreement by 2050 so that the global average temperature does not exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius based on pre-industrial revolution standards.

We must act as we only have one planet that we call home. 
.
.
#greenpeace #ClimateCrisis #ActOnClimate

node.text:
One of the biggest oil companies in the world just revealed its secrets - to an undercover journalist from Greenpeace #Unearthed.

Exxon held back climate action for decades, and is still doing it today. We went undercover with Exxon’s lobbyists to expose the truth.

Exxon's CEO is now trying to put blame onto the individual employee but their lobbying on climate change goes back decades.

Watch and share. Link in bio ☝️

via @greenpeaceuk 

#ExxonMobil #ClimateJustice #Exxon #ExxonKnew #bigoil #fossilfuels #fossilfools #climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatebreakdown #climatescience #science #lobbying #busted #unearthed #greenpeace #greenpeaceuk #greenpeaceunearthed #journalism #investigation #undercover

node.title: EXXON EXPOSED: undercover with Exxon’s lobbyists to expose the truth

node.text:
On this Day of the Seafarer, meet Hsuan, our oceans activist from Taiwan. She has recently returned from Greenpeace’s latest voyage to Indian Ocean.

“I can be your eyes fighting on the campaign frontline, exposing ocean crisis to those of you on land”

We cannot let our oceans continue to be destroyed. Join us to #ProtectTheOceans. Check link in bio ⬆️
.
.
#DayoftheSeafarers #greenpeace #oceans #nature #climatechange

node.text:
BREAKING: World leaders have arrived in #Cornwall to attend the #G7summit. And we were there to greet them in a way they won’t forget.
.
In a world first: Illuminated drones, light projections, kids and activists have come together to deliver one united message.
.
Stop extinction, act now. Watch and share. 
.
We have just eight years left to prevent catastrophic climate breakdown, we can’t afford any more empty promises. Hope comes from action not words.
.
Massive thank you to @celestial_drones @projectionsonwalls  @hannahpeelmusic @ulsterorchestra for their amazing contribution to this incredible video message. 
.
.
#G7UK #G7Cornwall #BuildBackBetter #Cornwall #CarbisBay #Change #G7 #ClimateAction #ActNow #ClimateLeadersAct #G7summit #Activisim #Drones #Projections #environment #climate #globalwarming #nature #savetheplanet #dronestagram #droneoftheday #aerial #aerialphotography #dronephotography #CivilSociety

node.text:
Amidst the global pandemic, access to vaccines should not be hoarded by a few rich countries. The virus is everywhere regardless of boundaries or borders - it’s a threat to the whole world. 
We must waive the intellectual property on the #COVID19 vaccine so that we can make more and save more people.
Stand in solidarity to demand #VaccinesForAll! 
#VaccineSolidarity #GreenpeaceIndia #Greenpeace

node.text:
How would you feel if you woke up one day to find huge machines threatening to destroy your home? That's what's facing Pacific communities if deep sea mining starts happening: a new industry that will destroy their environment and jeopardize their livelihoods.
.
Stand in solidarity with Victor and all the communities that would have to face the dire consequences of this destructive industry. Link in our bio.
.
.
.
.
#ProtectTheOceans

node.text:
"We have to redefine what nature and earth means....to realize it's not just a source of goods..."

What does fracking mean to the affected communities and what can they do about it? Alejandra told us more in our last panel discussion on the activism and resistance of communities to extractivism in Latin America. 

Watch the full conversation in the link in our bio⬆️
.
"Tenemos que resignificar lo que significa la naturaleza y la tierra ... para darnos cuenta de que no es solo una fuente de bienes ..."

¿Qué significa el fracking para las comunidades afectadas y qué pueden hacer al respecto? Alejandra nos contó más en nuestro último panel de discusión sobre el activismo y la resistencia de las comunidades al extractivismo en América Latina.

Mira la conversación completa en el link de nuestra bio⬆️

node.title: Alejandra x extractivismo en América Latina.

node.text:
We’re excited to share with you the animated cartoon version of children's climate change learning book "My House Disappeared” - created exclusively by @greenpeace_tw!

It’s time to go on an adventure with Toto and his friends 🐠🐨🐻‍❄️ to learn more about our environment and what we can do to protect it 💪
.
.
#ActOnClimate #ClimateCrisis #Greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on July 20, 2021. May be an image of nature, tree and fog.

node.text:
Fires have scorched huge swaths of eastern Russia in recent days, with Siberia's Yakutia region hit hardest.

Russia is experiencing abnormally dry and hot weather conditions, which is causing fires to spread at an alarming rate.

@greenpeaceru employees have been joining forces with volunteer firefighters, local authorities and residents to fight back.

They are working in punishing heat, walking long distances with heavy equipment, shovels and axes, digging trenches, moving from one site to another, delivering firefighting equipment, supporting investigations and training more volunteers.

This would not be possible without the support of so many people, allowing Greenpeace Russia to quickly respond to calls, source equipment and sound the alarm about Russia's environmental problems.

Scenes like these will be the new normal if we don’t take urgent action to stop fossil fuel-driven climate change. We need to treat this as the emergency that it is and push for urgent action.

📸: © Julia Petrenko / People of the Forest

#climateemergency #climatecrisis #fires #forestfires #yakutia #siberia #saveyakutia #greenpeace #greenpeacerussia #russia #forests #forestprotection #firefighting #firefighters #volunteers #solidarity #together4forests #extremeweather #fossilfuels #bigoil #greenrecovery #justrecovery

node.text:
#Regram #Repost @greenpeace_canada 🔁

Who wants to see a petition for an Earth re-entry tax? 🙋‍♀️🙆‍♀️ Jeff Bezos and Richard Branson having their little billionaire space race while the Earth is literally on fire is just 🤮

Here's why we need a #WealthTax NOW:

⭐️Make the ultra-rich pay their fair share of the COVID-19 recovery. The pandemic has not impacted everyone equally: The ultra-rich increased their profits, while essential workers and vulnerable populations struggled (according to articles in Business Insider, billionaires made at least $3.9 TRILLION extra at the height of the pandemic, while workers lost $3.7 trillion).

⭐️ Billionaires make their money by exploiting people – and the planet. The infinite growth economy that relies on extracting more and more and more from nature is what drives their profits. They make billions off their workers backs and treat those same people unfairly.

⭐️ Their businesses – and their lifestyles – are driving #ClimateChange. A 2020 report from @oxfaminternational and the Stockholm Environment Institute found that the wealthiest 1% of the world’s population were responsible for the emission of more than twice as much carbon dioxide as the poorer half of the world from 1990-2015. A study in Nature Communications titled 'Scientists’ warning on affluence' argues that we can't actually meet sustainability goals until we rein in the affluent overconsumption of the wealthy.

⭐️The unequal impacts of the COVID-19 crisis on those who have vs. those who don't was a mere preview to how the #ClimateCrisis will interact with structural inequality: "the climate crisis is going to produce two classes of refugees: those with the freedom and financial resources to try, for a while at least, to flee from growing threats in advance, and those who will be left behind to suffer the consequences in the form of illness, death and destruction." (from The Guardian article in the last image).

#TaxTheRich #Inequality #JustRecovery #ClimateJustice #FightInequality #memes #greenrecovery #justtransition #socialjustice #livesbeforeprofits #spacerace #jeffbezos #richardbranson #amazon #virgin #billionaires #climateemergency #climatechange

node.text:
Last week Greenland banned new oil and fossil gas exploration because of the severity of the climate crisis. Which country will be next?⁣
 ⁣
#FossilFreeRevolution #Greenpeace #FossilFuels #FossilFree #FossilGas #ClimateCrisis #ClimateEmergency #ClimateJustice #GreenRecovery #Future #Planet #JustRecovery #JustTransition

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on July 19, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, body of water and text that says 'LETS NOT LET THIS BE OUR NEW NORMAL TAKE ACTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE EXPLOKEAPO'.

node.text:
A torrent of unprecedented floods hit around the globe causing a tragic loss of life, colossal property damage and huge displacement of everyday people.

This is not natural, it is a climate emergency.

While there are many complex factors at play with extreme weather events, what we are experiencing is consistent with the predictions of a climate changed world.

Scientists have long sounded the alarm on the climate crisis. Companies and governments must take action to curb carbon emissions and stop putting profits over people and the planet.

We must move to rein in climate change and prevent future deadly extreme weather events like these.

#fossilfuels #greenrecovery #justrecovery #justtransition #climatechaos #extremeweather #floods #climatechange #climateemergency #climatecrisis #aotearoa #usa #uganda #india #oman #netherlands #germany #france

node.text:
Aurelie, a scientist from Mauritius and daughter of a fisherman, always felt a strong connection with the ocean.
.
Growing up by a beach she witnessed the unsustainable development affecting the ocean. Her life mission is to inspire future generations to protect the ocean, starting where land meets the sea.
.
@aurelie_hector @jake_letori
.
.
.
#VitalOceanVoices #ProtectTheOceans #IndianOcean #Mauritius #Madagascar #Seychelles #Oceans #Seas #Greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Image of fires in the Amazon with text: Fires and deforestation turned the Amazon into carbon emitter.

node.text:
The destruction of the Amazon is not allowing the forest to capture more carbon than what is released into the atmosphere by fires and deforestation. Yet, Bolsonaro’s anti-environmental agenda keeps pushing for more and more destruction. Losing the Amazon is a threat to biodiversity, Indigenous Peoples and to the global climate.
.
.
.
.
#SaveTheAmazon #ActForTheAmazon #Brazil #Brasil #Amazonia #Amazon #Environment

Messsage about Bolsonaro's government's agenda pushing for more destruction over an image of fires in the Amazon.

node.text:
The sea is rising higher and faster — floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.

But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.

How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming.

Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.

#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #Greenpeace #jakarta #taiwan #taipei #asia #globalwarming

node.accessibility_caption: Houses destroyed in Germnay due to severe floods and heavy rain in the country in the past few days.

node.text:
Over 100 people have died in the past few days from the severe floods devastating parts of Europe. This is not natural, it is a climate emergency. Companies and governments must take action to curb carbon emissions and stop putting profits over people and the planet.
.
Más de 100 personas han muerto en los últimos días a causa de las graves inundaciones que devastaron partes de Europa. Esto no es natural, es una emergencia climática. Las empresas y los gobiernos deben tomar medidas para frenar las emisiones de carbono y dejar de poner las ganancias sobre las personas y el planeta.
Photos 1 & 2: © Bernd Lauter / Greenpeace, 3 & 4: © Dominik Ketz / Greenpeace
.
.
.
.
#ClimateCrisis #ClimateEmergency #ClimateChange #Germany #Floods Belguim #Europe

Aerial view of flooded streets in Bad Neuenahr, Germany.
Greenpeace activists display a message outside a meeting of major oil companies and the Greenland Bureau of Minerals and Petroleum (BMP) in Copenhagen in 2011. 📷 Christian Åslund / Greenpeace

node.text:
🌍 Greenland has banned all new oil exploration due to escalating concerns for the climate and the Arctic environment! 🌍
.
This is a hard-won victory that follows years of creative, peaceful and persistent protest - and means Greenland joins Belize, France, Denmark, Aotearoa/New Zealand and other countries with similar oil exploration bans in place.
.
Here is part of that journey in pictures...
.
1. Greenpeace activists display a message outside a meeting of major oil companies and the Greenland Bureau of Minerals and Petroleum (BMP) in Copenhagen in 2011. 
📷 Christian Åslund / Greenpeace

2. Greenpeace activists board the Leiv Eiriksson oil platform, 180 km off the coast of Greenland, in 2011. 📷 Steve Morgan / Greenpeace

3. Paul Simonon, assistant cook on board the Greenpeace ship Esperanza and former bassist of British punk band The Clash, off the coast of Greenland in 2011. 📷 Steve Morgan / Greenpeace

4. Former Greenpeace International Executive Director Kumi Naidoo on the deck of the Esperanza, preparing to take action against the Leiv Eiriksson oil rig in the Davis Strait in 2011. 📷 Jiri Rezac / Greenpeace

5. The 53,000 tonne Leiv Eiriksson off the coast of Greenland. 📷 Steve Morgan / Greenpeace
.
.
.

#protecttheoceans #fossilfuel #Greenland #Denmark #Europe #Greenpeace #fossilfuelrevolution #oceans

Toyota & Hyundai are 2 of the best selling Asian car brands. But they are among the least ready to transition to EV. This impedes them from staying competitive in the net zero race.

node.text:
A new era of green mobility has arrived. The EU recently proposed to ban sales of cars with internal combustion engines by 2035, including hybrids and plug-in hybrids. 

Despite being the best selling Asian brands in Europe,Toyota and Hyundai are the least ready for this transition. The automobile giants must catch up in the race to #NetZero 📢📢
.
.
#DriveChange #toyota #hyundai #car #greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Toyota & Hyundai are 2 of the best selling Asian car brands. But they are among the least ready to transition to EV. This impedes them from staying competitive in the net zero race.
Quit hybrids. On average, plug-in hybrids emit 2 to 4 more CO2 than manufactureres claim, which is just a 30% improvement on gasoline/diesel cars.
Support the domestic automotive industry to transition to EVs by providing trainings for workers, reduce carbon emission in steel and battery production.
Move beyond producing more cars. Promote zero-carbon, sustainble mobility solutions that lead to reducing the individual use and ownership of cars.
Flooding on a residential street of white houses in Erkrath near Düsseldorf

node.text:
It's not just unusual and extreme weather happening in Europe, it’s the climate crisis. And this is only the beginning if governments continue to prioritize profits over people and the planet. 
.
As the atmosphere warms at an alarming rate, temperatures are rising to even new record levels, discharging in the form of storms. We cannot afford to wait any longer on climate action; the time to act is NOW.

Top of vehicle, almost fully covered by heavy flooding
